ai.summary: Hard 22.8 km circular hike known as the Ballater/Cambus o'May loop. The route threads through a mix of open moorland, forest tracks, and occasional rocky sections, with notable elevation changes and potential navigation challenges. It is best tackled by experienced hikers with good fitness, preparation, and a map or GPS.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect long exposed sections over heather moor and grassy paths, interspersed with woodland trails and rough, uneven ground. Some stretches can be boggy or rocky, and water crossings may be encountered after rain. Terrain can be varied and remote in places, so reliable navigation and footwear are essential.
ai.safety_notes: Plan according to weather; UK conditions can change quickly. Start with plenty of daylight; carry a map and compass or GPS, and know your route. Wear sturdy footwear and bring waterproof clothing and extra layers. Carry sufficient water and high-energy food; have a small first aid kit and a means to signal for help (whistle, fully charged phone). Consider trekking poles for balance; inform someone of your planned return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone with offline maps
Lightweight emergency bivvy or space blanket
First aid kit including blister care
Whistle and headlamp with spare batteries
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offers the best hiking conditions in the UK, but be prepared for sudden weather changes and muddy sections year-round.
